div.p: Box model results. Current legislation emission (CLE) and maximum feasible reduction (MFR) scenarios for anthropogenic impact on atmospheric methane concentrations towards 2100. The natural emission scenarios are from Fig. 1(I–IV). Each additional 50 Tg CH 4/yr increase in natural emissions over the 2006–2100 period increase CH 4 concentration in 2100 by about 200 ppb. But CH 4 concentration in 2100 is reduced by about 1400–1500 ppb in response to going from CLE to MFR.
